title.narrative: European Microfinance Fund for Southeast Europe

description.narrative: The proposed project involves the creation of a Euro 500 million collective debt investment vehicle, named The European Microfinance Fund for Southeast Europe (EFSE, or the company), which will make investments in microfinance institutions in the Southeast Europe region. EFSE aims to attract investments from multilateral, bilateral, as well as private institutional investors, via multiple closings. The promoter of this project is KfW. The purpose of the project is to provide development finance in the Southeast Europe region through the local financial institutions, focusing on the credit needs of micro and small businesses and private households. The company presents a unique opportunity to create a public-private partnership which leverages private capital and supports the economic growth and job creation in the region. In parallel with the creation of the company, a Development Facility will be established to provide technical assistance to the investee institutions assisting them in their development and growth. The management company will be Oppenheim Pramerica, a prime asset management firm, in consortium with microfinance specialist advisor, Bankakademie.

participating-org.narrative: The European Fund For Southeast Europe S.A., SA

mailing-address.narrative: Mrs Monica Beck, KfW Private and Financial Sector Development Europe Tel: (49-69) 7431 4069 Fax: (49-69) 7431 2547 Palmengartenstrasse 5-9, D-60325 Frankfurt am Main, Germany

name.narrative: EFSE will be incorporated in Luxembourg, as an investment company and is expected to make investments in qualified financial institutions (i.e. Commercial Banks and NGOs) in Southeastern European countries/entities, including but not limited to Bosnia & Herzegovina, Serbia, Montenegro, Kosovo.

activity-description.narrative: A description that qualifies the activity taking place at the location.

sector.narrative: HA - Microfinance and Small Business - Non Commercial Banking
